thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL BASKETBALL: MVP Arena announces new, high school basketball event, set for Feb. 7-8
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL BASKETBALL: MVP Arena announces new, high school basketball event, set for Feb. 7-8

author: Drew Wemple
title: HIGH SCHOOL BASKETBALL: MVP Arena announces new, high school basketball event, set for Feb. 7-8
text:
ALBANY, N.Y. — MVP Arena is putting Section 2 basketball back on its center stage.
On Thursday, MVP Arena announced, via a press release, that it will host the inaugural, ‘MVP Arena Challenge,’ on Friday, Feb. 7, and Saturday, Feb. 8, 2025, in downtown Albany.
“This event is about more than just basketball; it’s about creating lifelong memories for our student-athletes and their families,” said Bob Belber, MVP Arena General Manager. “We’re thrilled to host these games and bring our community together to celebrate local talent.”
MVP Arena’s marquee letters were placed on top of Albany’s sports and entertainment venue, formerly known as the Times Union Center. Albany County Executive Daniel P. McCoy and Deputy County Executive Daniel Lynch were joined by MVP Health Care’s Sr. Leader, Marketing & Communications Mollie Rooney and VP of Community Engagement Ellen Sax. (Photo provided)
The Troy High School varsity boys basketball team defeated Saratoga Springs, 72-69, on Saturday, Dec. 21, 2024, at SSHS, in Saratoga Springs, N.Y. (PHOTO BY DREW WEMPLE - MEDIANEWSGROUP)
The Columbia High School boys varsity basketball team, defeated Ballston Spa, 76-69, on Wednesday, February, 21, 2024, in a Section 2 Class AA Championship First Round Playoff Game at Columbia HS, in East Greenbush, NY. (PHOTO BY DREW WEMPLE)
The Ballston Spa High School girls varsity basketball team defeated Troy, 65-41, in a Section 2 Class AA First Round matchup at Ballston Spa HS, on Friday, February 17, 2024. (PHOTO BY DREW WEMPLE)

McCoy and Deputy County Executive Daniel Lynch were joined by MVP Health Care’s Sr. Leader, Marketing & Communications Mollie Rooney and VP of Community Engagement Ellen Sax. (Photo provided)
Expand On Friday, the slate tips off with contests between both the Albany High School and Ballston Spa girls and boys basketball teams, at 5 p.m. and 6:30 p.m., respectively. On Saturday, the Voorheesville girls varsity team will play Ichabod Crane, at 5 p.m., followed by a matchup between the Lansingburgh and Troy boys’ varsity teams, at 6:30 p.m.
“This inaugural event not only promises an exciting showcase of local talent but also provides student-athletes with the memorable experience of playing on the same court as collegiate and professional athletes,” wrote an MVP Arena spokesperson.
The event is presented by the Innovation Partnership – a collaboration between Albany County and MVP Health Care.
“We are thrilled the Innovation Partnership is able to support the MVP Arena Challenge,” said Albany County Executive Daniel P. McCoy. “This event not only celebrates the incredible talent of our local student-athletes but also reinforces our commitment to creating opportunities that bring our community together and inspire future generations.”
Tickets for the MVP Arena Challenge go on sale starting at 10 a.m. on Tuesday, Jan. 21, 2025. Fans can purchase tickets for $5 at the MVP Arena Box Office or for $5 (including fees) online at Ticketmaster.com.
“We are excited to partner with Albany County for the MVP Arena Challenge – an event that will not only highlight the incredible talent of local high school athletes, but also underscores our commitment to promoting a healthy and active lifestyle,” said MVP Health Care’s Chief Market Strategy and Product Officer, Augusta Martin. “We look forward to seeing the community come together to support these young athletes and celebrate their achievements at the MVP Arena.”
“We are very grateful for the MVP Arena and Innovation Partnership for offering this unique opportunity,” said Doug Gejay, Executive Director of Section 2 of the NYSPHSAA, Inc. “The teams involved are extremely appreciative and are looking forward to this exciting experience.”
